meanings.definition: To present or regard as a problem
meanings.sent1: She always problematizes any situation, making it seem more difficult than it is.
meanings.sent2: The teacher problematizes the math question to encourage critical thinking.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to problematize even the simplest tasks can be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fog problematizes the view, shrouding everything in mystery.
meanings.sent5: Her constant need to problematize everything around her can be exhausting.

meanings.sent1: The lack of instructions problematizes the assembly of the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The sudden change in weather problematizes our outdoor plans.
meanings.sent3: His habit of problematizing every decision often leads to delays.
meanings.sent4: The maze of corridors problematizes navigation through the building.
meanings.sent5: The technical issues problematize the completion of the project.

meanings.definition: To question or challenge the validity of
meanings.sent1: The scientist problematizes the existing theory with new evidence.
meanings.sent2: It is important to problematize assumptions to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: His constant need to problematize authority figures can be quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The detective problematizes the alibi of the suspect during interrogation.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer problematizes the witness's testimony to uncover the truth.
